name: Actors' Other Lives Quiz | Celebrities Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: Dennis Farina, star of such movies as "Midnight Run" and "Get Shorty" and TV shows "In-Laws" and "Crime Story", had this occupation before becoming an actor.
questions.explanation:
Policeman.

	Once claimed in an interview that as a Chicago cop he was such a bad shot, he earned the nickname "The Great Wounder."

questions.text: Charles Dutton, star of the TV show "Roc" and movies "Aliens 3" and "The Distinguished Gentleman", spent his early adulthood in prison.  For what crime was he in jail?
questions.explanation:
Homicide.

	He fatally stabbed a man in a street fight when he was 17.  (Whether it was murder or manslaughter I'm not sure.) He acquired the acting bug while participating in a drama group in prison.  In his new life, he has received Tony, Emmy, Golden Globe, Image, and SAG nominations and awards for his powerful performances.

questions.text: Gloria Stuart, Oscar-nominated actress for her role in "Titanic" (1997), was first an actress before World War II, but then retired from acting to raise a family and excel at this profession:
questions.explanation:
Painting.

	She has had one-woman shows of her work in New York, Austria, and Italy.  She also said, after her nomination for "Titanic", "When I graduated from Santa Monica High in 1927, I was voted the girl most likely to succeed. I didn't realize it would take so long."

questions.text: Harrison Ford had little initial success in acting, so he taught himself this trade before making it big in movies like "American Graffiti" and "Star Wars".
Fred Thompson, of such movies as "No Way Out", "Baby's Day Out", "The Hunt for Red October", and "Die Hard 2", was first a(n) ______, then an actor, then a(n) _____ ?
questions.explanation:
Lawyer / Senator.

	He was inadvertantly in Oliver Stone's "JFK", as he was on the Watergate committee as a lawyer, footage of which was in the movie.  In 1994, he was elected senator for his home state of Tennessee.  Also, before becoming a lawyer, he was a shoe salesman, truck driver, and a factory worker. And an update (2002): Thompson is once again an actor.  He decided not to run for his US Senate seat again, and is now playing District Attorney Arthur Branch on the long-running "Law & Order".

questions.text: Before making it in acting, which of these Academy-award winning actresses worked as a bricklayer, a bank teller, and in a mortuary applying make-up to corpses?
questions.explanation:
Whoopi Goldberg.

	Was nicknamed Whoopi (as in "whoopi-cushion") because of being overly flatulent. She added the name Goldberg, taken from the Jewish side of her family.

questions.text: This character actor was a farmer, a rodeo rider, a body guard (to Howard Hughes), a blacksmith, all before becoming an actor.

Somewhere in California, there is a little girl named Roberta, named after the policeman that helped birth her in an emergency delivery.  This policeman had been an actor in the 1960s and 1970s before joining the LAPD.  He is ________ ?
questions.explanation:
Bobby Sherman.

	He was more famously known for his bubble-gum rock singing career.

questions.text: Which beautiful silent-then-talkies movie actress worked as a soap-latherer in a barber's shop before making it big?
questions.explanation:
Greta Garbo.

	After World War II, Greta, by her own admission, felt that the world had changed perhaps forever and she retired, never again to face the camera. She would work for the rest of her life to perpetuate the Garbo mystique.

questions.text: Burt Reynolds was drafted by which NFL team?
questions.explanation:
Baltimore Colts.

	Attended Florida State University on a football scholarship, but only played in two seasons. He was a star running back. His college football career was ended by a knee injury.
